Title: Concerto Grosso for Piano and 'Cello
Details: A Concerto Grosso for Piano and 'Cello in two movements, with Wind and String Quintets, Percussion and Harp accompaniment.

Title: Our side of the river
Details:
`Our side of the river` a chamber opera in two acts by Murray Dahm and Benjamin Loomes.

Libretto by Murray Dahm and Benjamin Loomes.
Music by Benjamin Loomes. For Soprano, Mezzo soprano, Tenor, and Baritone with chamber orchestra.
Flute, Cello, Piano, Percussion, Soprano, Tenor, Mezzo-soprano, Baritone

Title: Symphony in B - of Love and War - No. 3
Details:
A more contemplative symphony, but not without moments of great passion.

Symphony in B was performed in 2021 by the Sydney Youth Orchestra Philharmonic under the baton of Maestro Brian Buggy.

Title: Amnesia in rag
Details: A challenging work for piano: a dubious ragtime not quite recollected properly!

Title: Scherzo
Details: A short scherzo for symphony orchestra and piano. The strength of the modern orchestra is in the creation of colour. Focused ensemble performance allows players from across the choirs of the orchestra to be combined in both traditional and novel ensembles, their tones, both pure and subverted create unique timbral and textural effects. Juxtaposed, these colours grab and maintain the interest of the listener, leading them ever onwards in the ever-light-hearted continuing joke—the Scherzo.

Title: Piano Trio No. 2 - Le Petit Prince
Details:
Elden's 2nd piano trio, on Antoine de Saint-Exupéry's `Le Petit Prince`. This work is an emotional journey through fragments of this classic tale, at times light-hearted and at others sincere. The harmony lives in a place of sweet modality, with folk elements giving way to a raw core in the 4th movement.

Trivia: the website banner is an image of the manuscript!
Preview page titles: Title page, Page 1 of movement I of score, Page 3 of movement I of score
Tags (happy, sad, meditative, ironic): sweet, death, folk, modal, chamber, featured

Title: In Memoriam Auream
Details:
`In Memoriam Auream` was Elden's HSC core composition—a dense study of the avant-garde.

In this work, players represent an alien sonic landscape of the avant-garde, estranged from any musical comprehension and dominated by a distorted piano, contrasted with a slow nostalgic waltz that can do naught but fade into the past while we, the audience, are left with the uncomfortable presence of what this art has become.`

The density of writing makes this work ideal for HSC Music 2 musicology. You download a score here. If you're using this, please let me know by emailing elden@loomesmusic.com!

Title: Vie - Quatuor rythmique
Details: Vie: Quatuor rythmique, 'Life: a rhythmic quartet' depicts the various bold colours of the composer's life and music through the dense interactions and reactions of the chamber tradition.

Title: Scintillate
Details: Ok, well you can't really play this one, but you can listen to it! Composed for Syrinscape's music for the Call of Cthulhu campaign Mask of Nyarlathotep. Composited from a number of synths, a viola, a cello, this version of this piece was suitably ruined passing through a pair of headphones back into a mic' on the way to your ears.

Title: Three Splintered Keys
Details:
A trio of short pieces for piano.

I - Rebellion from Fugue
A (very) short fugue for piano, written in Schoenberg's 12-tone serialist method.

II - Childish Nightmare
A play on Frère Jacques in a whole tone mode. Probably doesn't stand up to Mahler's setting though...

III - Parisian Peak Hour
Have you seen the traffic around the Arche de Triomphe? It's mad!

Title: The Swallowtail
Details:
`The Swallowtail` is a work for flute & piano, or flute & harp, ideal for graduating performance from senior high school. Its buoyant energetic nature evokes the free flight of a butterfly. It is wide ranging, traversing almost the entire range of the flute, is quickly accessible to listeners, and is an ideal vehicle to display agility, technical control, expression, tonal variation, and dramatic flair.

Purchase this work from Wirripang.
Ensemble (e.g. `string quartet`): Flute solo (with Piano or Harp accompaniment)
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University
Tags (happy, sad, meditative, ironic): butterfly, fun, modal, happy, pleasant, HSC, HSCPerformance

Title: The lost jewel
Details:
`The lost jewel` is a work for SSA choir, a setting of the Dickinson poem, ideal for high school aged girls. The `jewel` may represent a lover lost, a friend who has become distant, or anything that was once taken for granted, but who's absence now painfully stings. `Prosy` means` wearisome`.

Purchase this work from Wirripang.
Tags (happy, sad, meditative, ironic): SSA, choir, girls, Emily Dickinson, poetry, women, woman, beautiful

Title: The River
Details:
`The River` is a work for flute & piano, ideal for graduating performance from senior high school. It flows freely with a gently lilting, evocative melody. It is wide ranging, accessible to the listener, and is an ideal vehicle to display agility, technical control, expression, and tonal variation. `The River` was commissioned by the Manly Selective Campus of the Northern Beaches Secondary College in Sydney Australia for use by a graduating student in her state-wide final performance exam.

Purchase this work from Wirripang.
HSC, senior high school level, Amus, University

Title: Breaking the bones of hell
Details:
Four brave warriors
Paladin wielding radiant blade
Mage with hands full of fire
Rogue coming like death in the night
And Cleric with a loving kiss
Four brave warriors
Breaking the bones of hell`

`Breaking the bones of hell`, gives orchestras a chance to dig their teeth into something rhythmic and vibrant. A persistent accompaniment supports sweeping melodies and powerful brass. Composed for combat sequences in table top games and first heard in the Syrinscape app, the piece will bring both players and audiences awake.

Manly Selective Campus Chamber Orchestra
Conducted by Elizabeth Scott
Tags (happy, sad, meditative, ironic): rhythmic, vibrant, game music, Dungeons & Dragons

Title: March of the Osolith Horde
Details: First heard in the Syrinscape app, this aggressive, inevitable march is a fun play for any concert band. With a persistent pedal point throughout most of the work, this 'March' makes a strong statement, is engaging to play, and is also a useful vehicle for practising blending at high dynamic levels. An audience pleaser that works well with creative lighting and fantasy projection, this makes for a memorable addition to any program.

Title: Isabella
Details:
`Isabella` is a small ensemble work, featuring the clarinet, ideal for concert or exam performance. It serves as a great vehicle to showcase tone, agility, expression, and ensemble playing. Its yearning mixed modal harmony is accessible by young performers and audiences alike. `Isabella` was commissioned by the Manly Selective Campus of the Northern Beaches Secondary College in Sydney Australia for use by a graduating student in her state-wide final performance exam. The work is named after the Manly student who gave it its premiere.

Purchase this work from Wirripang.
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University

Title: Sentinels
Details:
Touched by the termite mounds in Litchfield National Park, the poet muses on their eternal nature, their sense of deep belonging, and the feeling that they are watching over us all, like sentinels.

Words and music by Benjamin Loomes.
Voice, Tenor, Soprano, Violin, Viola, Cello
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University

Title: Floating
Details:
A perfect vehicle for showcasing tone, flexibility and expression this beautiful cello piece is ideal for senior high-school performance or recital alike.

Purchase this work from Wirripang.
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University

Title: Buoyant
Details:
`I wish I were someone who truly could fly, but was dreaming I could walk.` When I fly in my dreams, when I kick off the ground in just the right way I can 'balance' at the top of my leap and slide along weightless. This orchestral piece seeks to suspend the audience's return to earth for as long as possible, remaining buoyant, free, and floating. An ideal work for senior high school orchestral players or professional musicians alike.

Purchase this work from Wirripang.

Title: Audition song
Details: Sopranos are always 'so lovely' to each other, especially when they are in competition for a role. This show stopper is a powerhouse demonstration of range and flexibility that is sure to impress the panel... and demorilise the competition.
HSC, senior high school level, Amus, University

Title: Dreaming
Details: This song is a warning to the composer himself against heaping up treasures and riches in a fantasy world of imagination and vanity. The song speaks of infidelity's temporary fulfilling, enriching and enlivening nature, which almost always ends in sorrow, regret and bitterness.
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University
Video Description: Performed at the University of Sydney - Old Darlington School April 8, 2006 Tenor: Benjamin Loomes Pianist: Simon Kenway
Tags (happy, sad, meditative, ironic): expressive, dramatic, heartfelt, yearning, regretful, artsong

Title: I have a place within my heart
Details: In this aria, from the Opera `Our side of the river`, Susanna sings of her secret love, a man with whom she has shared a passionate affair, nights of sensuality and release, which they both new they would inevitably lose. Although she must now let go of the relationship, she will always hold him in the secret parts of her heart.
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University
Preview page titles: Page 1 of vocal score, Page 2 of vocal score, Page 1 of orchestral score
Tags (happy, sad, meditative, ironic): passionate, opera, operatic, chamber, soprano, desire, passion, loss, yearning, artsong

Title: In my mind there is a golden thread
Details: In this aria, from the Opera `Our side of the river`, William struggles with desire, temptation, the need for passion, connection and... guilt. He is caught by a woman, enthralled, enraptured. He is struggling to do the 'right' thing, with every fibre of his being driving him into her arms.
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University

Title: Nature reversed
Details: This stanza of Eliot's poem speaks of young, enraptured lovers discovering each other and becoming 'one'. In the song the stanza is first set backwards then forwards, symbolically trapping time in a dream-like circle of eternal sighs. The lovers are one with each other and one with God (Adonai).
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University

Title: The assembly of God
Details: Driving through Goulburn, the poet, Ann Howard, confronted by a flashing neon sign, was struck with the idea of parishioners weekly assembling God. Note the various biblical allusions including the `Good Samaritan` in the lines starting `Drivers pass by on the other side`.
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University

Title: Watermelons
Details: Challenged to compose a song about fruit by a soprano friend, a very serious exposition of the virtues and dangers of this, one of the most substantial fruits we regularly relate to, was Benjamin's answer.
HSC, senior high school level, Grade 8, University
Tags (happy, sad, meditative, ironic): fruity, satirical, sexual, comical, ridiculous, artsong

Title: Lament for Gandalf
Details: This work for cello and piano is a beautiful, haunting, minimalist meditation on the death of this most beloved of literary Wizards.

Title: Songs and Laments for Cello Solo
Details:
A collection of short works for solo cello, including:

   Fantasia et Variations: a set of loose variations on a theme by the composer.

   Näf - des petites chansons du violoncelle: a set of very short songs reminiscent of a baroque suite.

   Fughetta: a fugue for solo cello.

   Sarabande: a mournful neo-baroque sarabande.

The works evoke a distinct contrapunctal style, mixing the sensibilities of Britten, Bloch and Bach.
HSC, senior high school level, high school level
Preview page titles: Page 1 of Fantasia et Variations, Page 1 of Naif

Title: Rain - an etude in drops
Details: A very short additive étude for solo piano.

Title: Wine-dark sea
Details: A sonatina for any clarinet in 3 movements: (Introduction), Fughetta and Song.

Title: Pigs that fly
Details: A playful caprice for solo violin. This piece is ideally suited for the HSC performance core of an AmusA level violinist, and was written for the NBSC Manly Selective class of 2021.

Title: Agnus Dei
Details: An SATB setting of the Agnus Dei, inspired by the choral works of Allegri and Dvorak.

Title: Quickening
Details: A graceful and spirited fantasia for oboe.

Title: Prelude - for cello solo
Details:
This prelude is a dramatic mix of Bach and Britten, exploring the full timbral, registral and expressive range of the instrument.

Elden wrote this piece for his own HSC music 2 performance core.
